trend_summary: Mostly wooded hills progressively convert to a rural patchwork. Cropland broadens in valleys, forest fragments on central slopes, and a straight corridor road/line appears. Village footprints grow only slightly. The final scene shows widespread browning and canopy loss, likely from drought, fire or logging, confirming a gradual but limited human footprint in an overall sparse landscape.
notable_changes: Construction of a straight westâ€“east transport or utility corridor through the northern half.
Expansion of patchwork cropland in southern and eastern valleys, replacing forest.
Progressive fragmentation and reduction of forest cover on central hillsides.
Minor enlargement of village clusters at valley junctions, though settlement remains limited.
Latest image shows extensive browning of slopes, indicating drought, wildfire or accelerated logging.
